thread.title: Alex Skarlatos leaves ‘DWTS’ to visit family, friends after Oregon shooting
thread.title_full: Alex Skarlatos leaves ‘DWTS’ to visit family, friends after Oregon shooting

author: Bee Staff
title: Alex Skarlatos leaves ‘DWTS’ to visit family, friends after Oregon shooting
text:
Alex Skarlatos leaves ‘DWTS’ to visit family, friends after Oregon shooting Alex Skarlatos, left, with his “DWTS” partner Lindsay Arnold. Entertainment Tonight i 
Bee Staff 
French train hero Alek Skarlatos left “Dancing With The Stars” rehearsals Thursday to be with friends and family in Roseburg, Ore., after hearing about a deadly shooting at Umpqua Community College , where he is a student. 
He’s currently an Army National Guardsman in Oregon. 
He tweeted this after the shooting. Heading home to roseburg tonight. Everyone send thoughts and prayers to the families — alek skarlatos (@alekskarlatos) October 2, 2015 
Skarlatos, 22, helped prevent a possible terrorist attack on a train in France while on vacation with Sacramento area friends Spencer Stone and Anthony Sadler. 
Skarlatos told Ellen DeGeneres in an interview that he was enrolled in Umpqua Community College, where a gunman killed nine people on campus Thursday. Here’s some of that interview. 
KCRA’s David Bienick, who is covering the shooting, tweeted that Skarlatos would have had a Thursday class but he had dropped registration because of his “DWTS” committment. Skarlatos says he was planning to return to UCC and would've had a Thurs class. But dropped registration bc of DWTS. — David Bienick (@kcrabienick) October 2, 2015 
Skarlatos, Stone and Sadler are hailed as international heroes after thwarting a gunman armed with an assault rifle and hundreds of rounds of ammunition in August. French officials said the man was planning mass murder on a high-speed train bound from Amsterdam to Paris. 
The gunman at Umpqua Community College has been identified as Chris Harper Mercer, 26. He died after exchanging gunfire with police. Skarlotos says he never met #UCCshooting suspect but friends in Roseburg tell him he was "a loner". pic.twitter.com/O6jGJl3mnH — David Bienick (@kcrabienick) October 2, 2015 Related content
